data: The midnight sun had set, but in a crotch between two snow-peaks it had kindled a vast caldron from which rose a mist of jewels, garnet and turquoise, topaz and amethyst and opal, all swimming in a sea of molten gold.
The Yukon Trail: A Tale of the North
Raine, William MacLeod, 1871-1954; Wolfe, George Ellis [Illustrator]
